channel.title: World News, News of World, Top World News, World Breaking Headlines - Times of India
channel.description: TOI delivers the Top Latest World news and Headlines from US, UK, Gulf, Pakistan, China, Europe and rest of the world.

image.title: World News, News of World, Top World News, World Breaking Headlines - Times of India

item.title: US attorney general Holder to resign, official says
item.description: US attorney general Eric Holder will announce his resignation at the White House today, justice department and White House officials said.

item.title: Pope sacks Paraguay bishop in new sex abuse scandal
item.description: Pope Francis today sacked a Paraguayan bishop who had been accused of protecting a suspected paedophile priest.

item.title: Poroshenko says Ukraine crisis approaching end
item.description: Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko said today he was confident that his peace deal with pro-Russian insurgents means the "most dangerous" part of the five-month conflict is over.

item.title: France considers joining Syria air strikes
item.description: France is considering whether to extend its air strikes to Syria and increase security in public places after militants linked to the Islamic State group beheaded a French hostage, officials said on Thursday.

item.title: Rescue effort on for hundreds on stricken boat off Cyprus
item.description: A Cypriot cruise ship was trying on Thursday to rescue hundreds of migrants, most of them women and children, after their boat hit rough seas off the coast of the eastern Mediterranean island.

item.title: Cameron urges unity against Isis 'evil' as UK prepares to strike Iraq
item.description: British prime minister David Cameron has told the UN General Assembly that UK was ready to play its part in confronting "an evil against which the whole world must unite".

item.title: Judge delays Marathon bombing trial, won't move it
item.description: A judge granted a two-month trial delay on Wednesday for Boston Marathon bombing suspect Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, but denied a defense request to move his trial from Boston.

item.title: ISIS’ harsh brand of Islam is rooted in Saudi creed
item.description: Caliph Ibrahim, the leader of the Islamic State, appeared to come out of nowhere when he matter-of-factly proclaimed himself the ruler of all Muslims in the middle of an otherwise typical Ramadan sermon.

item.title: Turkish leader says world not doing enough
item.description: The president of Turkey on Wednesday accused the international community of doing too little to stem the flow of foreign fighters to Syria and slammed the UN Security Council's inaction on some of the world's most pressing issues.

item.title: US hits Islamic State group in Syria and Iraq
item.description: US fighter jets and bombers expanded their aerial campaign against Islamic State targets Wednesday, striking the militants in both Syria and Iraq even as the extremists pressed their offensive in Kurdish areas within sight of the Turkish border, where fleeing refugees told of civilians beheaded and towns torched.

item.title: Wife of Isis hostage receives life plea
item.description: The wife of British aid worker Alan Henning, held hostage by the Islamic State group, said on Tuesday she had received an audio message from him pleading for his life.

item.title: Edward Snowden honored with 'alternative Nobel'
item.description: Edward Snowden was among the winners on Wednesday of a Swedish human rights award, sometimes referred to as the "alternative Nobel," for his disclosures of top secret surveillance programs.

item.title: Jihadists claim beheading of Frenchman captured in Algeria
item.description: Jihadists linked to the Islamic State group claimed to have beheaded a Frenchman abducted in Algeria in a video posted online Wednesday, after Paris rejected their demand to halt strikes in Iraq.

item.title: S Korea to pay $7 billion for 40 F-35A fighter jets
item.description: South Korea is to pay $7 billion for 40 F-35A fighter jets under the terms of a deal with Lockheed Martin announced on Wednesday by the state arms procurer.

item.title: Death threats for Saudi pilots after raids on jihadists
item.description: Saudi pilots who conducted air strikes on jihadists in Syria received online death threats on Wednesday after photos were published of those involved, among them a son of the crown prince.

item.title: Hamas, Fatah begin talks in Cairo to resolve disputes
item.description: Rival Palestinian factions Hamas and president Mahmud Abbas's Fatah began talks in Cairo on Wednesday aimed at resolving internal disputes and reviving their unity government.

item.title: US drone kills 10 in northwest Pakistan
item.description: A suspected US drone fired four missiles at a vehicle carrying Uzbek and local militants in Pakistan's northwestern tribal region near the Afghan border on Wednesday, killing 10 of them, two Pakistani intelligence officials said.

item.title: 300 sick or dead found in Ebola lockdown: Sierra Leone
item.description: Sierra Leone said on Wednesday around 100 bodies and 200 patients had been collected from homes during its three-day lockdown to stem the deadly Ebola epidemic raging in west Africa.

item.title: Nato sees pullback of Russian troops from Ukraine
item.description: Nato has observed a significant withdrawal of Russian forces from inside Ukraine, but many Russian troops remain stationed nearby, an alliance military spokesman said on Wednesday.

item.title: Nepal PM Koirala free of cancer after treatment
item.description: Nepal's Prime Minister Sushil Koirala, who was diagnosed with first stage lung cancer and underwent radiotherapy sessions in the US, has fully recovered from the disease, his close aide said on Wednesday.

item.title: Sarkozy corruption probe suspended: Source
item.description: A corruption and influence-peddling investigation launched in July against former French president Nicolas Sarkozy has been suspended, days after he dramatically announced a political comeback.

item.title: Japan announces additional sanctions on Russia
item.description: Japan said on Wednesday that it is imposing additional sanctions on Russia, toughening its stance against Moscow to bring it more in line with steps taken by other nations, including its key ally the United States.

item.title: Queen 'purred' at Scottish independence result: Cameron
item.description: Britain's Queen Elizabeth II "purred" when she was told that Scotland had voted against independence, British Prime Minister David Cameron was filmed saying on Tuesday.

item.title: US airstrikes target terror cell plotting attack
item.description: S forces took advantage of the airstrikes against the Islamic State extremist group in Syria to try to simultaneously wipe out the leadership of an unrelated cell of veterans of al-Qaida.

item.title: US airstrikes target terror cell plotting attack
item.description: S forces took advantage of the airstrikes against the Islamic State extremist group in Syria to try to simultaneously wipe out the leadership of an unrelated cell of veterans of al-Qaida.
